column4: if I cancel the ubuntu upgrade to 11 from within 10.10, can I resume it later?
its too slow at the moment.
if it's only at the download stage, it's ok
but I will lose everything I've downloaded so far right? :-(
no
oh, that's nice then.. its in the "Getting new packages" page.. its already fetched some 150 packages.
what card?
do you know what video card you have?
nautilus-open-terminal
the user you created during install is in the admin group which can sudo by default
/opt/cyberoam/crclient/foo
./crclient: You can run the executable with name `crclient' only.
in my case foo = crclient (the executable is the same name as the directory holdign it)
when I do a ./foo
first issue is your ^M at the end of the line, second is that you probably want php5 (not sure on this; check that you have /usr/bin/php)
when I said "you want php5", I meant "/usr/bin/php5" instead of "/usr/bin/php" by the way
^M in your output
ah, php5-cli.postinst sets up /usr/bin/php with alternatives :D
oh c'mon, not the language war again.
just kidding around
hehe. well I've been a Java, C# and PHP developer in my life. I think php works well. Never seen it become a bottleneck _yet_.
